intro: Montolivaea unalaschensis, commonly known as the Alaskan tansy, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of Alaska. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along the shores and is adapted to the harsh coastal climate. Its leaves are aromatic and contain compounds that have been used traditionally by indigenous peoples. Montolivaea unalaschensis plays an important ecological role in stabilizing coastal dunes and providing habitat for local wildlife.
